Annotation.String: Describe data protection capabilities

The capabilities to protect data from loss by the use of a replica. The requirements must be met collectively by the communication path and the replica. There will be one instance associated to a class of service for each replica. Each replica has its own class of service that describes its characteristics.
Describe io performance capabilities.
Each instance of IOPerformanceLoSCapabilities shall describe the capabilities of the system to support various IO performance service options.
The value identifies this resource.
The value shall be unique within the managed ecosystem.
Limiting IOPS is supported.

If true, the system should limit IOPS to MaxIOOperationsPerSecondPerTerabyte * (Volume Size in Terabytes). Otherwise, the system shall not inforce a limit. The default value for this property is false.
Minimum sampling period over which average values are calculated.
The value shall be an ISO 8601 duration specifying the minimum sampling period over which average values are calculated.
Maximum sampling period over which average values are calculated.
The value shall be an ISO 8601 duration specifying the maximum sampling period over which average values are calculated.
Minimum supported average IO latency.
The value shall be the minimum supported average IO latency in microseconds calculated over the SamplePeriod
A collection of supported workloads.
The value shall be a collection of supported workloads.
Collection of known and supported IOPerformanceLinesOfService.
The value shall be a collection supported IO performance service options.
Describe service option within the IO performance line of service.
This structure may be used to define a service option related to IO performance.
Limit the IOPS.
If true, the system should not allow IOPS to exceed MaxIoOperationsPerSecondPerTerabyte * VolumeSize. Otherwise, the system shall not enforce a limit. The default value for this property is false.
Sampling period over which average values are calculated.
The value shall be an ISO 8601 duration specifying the sampling period over which average values are calculated.
The amount of IOPS a volume of a given committed size can support.

The value shall be the amount of IOPS a volume of a given committed size in Terabytes can support. This IOPS density value is useful as a metric that is independent of capacity. Cost is a function of this value and the AverageIOOperationLatencyMicroseconds.
Expected average IO latency.
The value shall be the expected average IO latency in microseconds calculated over sample periods (see SamplePeriodSeconds).
A description of the expected workload.

The value shall be a description of the expected workload. The workload provides the context in which the values of MaxIOOperationsPerSecondPerTerabyte and AverageIOOperationLatencyMicroseconds are expected to be achieveable.
An IO Workload description.
This structure may be used to describe an IO Workload.
The workload name.

The value shall be a name of the workload. It should be constructed as OrgID:WorkloadID. Examples: ACME:DSS, ACME:DSS-REP, ACME:Exchange, ACME:OLTP, ACME:OLTP-REPA. An organization may define a set of well known workloads.
An array of IO workload component descriptions.
The value shall be an array of IO workload component descriptions.
Describe a component of a IO workload.
This structure may be used to describe a component of an IO workload.
Expected access pattern for this component.
The enumeration literal shall be the expected access pattern.
Average I/O Size for this component.
The value shall be the expected average I/O size.
Percent of data for this workload component.
The value shall be the expected percent of the data referenced by the workload that is covered by this component.
Percent of total IOPS for this workload component.
The value shall be the expected percent of the total IOPS for this workload that is covered by this component
Duration that this component is active.

The value of each entry shall be an ISO 8601 duration that shall specify the expected length of time that this component is applied to the workload. This attribute shall be specified if a schedule is specified and otherwise shall not be specified.
Specifies when to apply this workload component.
The value shall specifies when this workload component is applied to the overall workload.
Typical IO access patterns.
The enumeration literals may be used to specify an IO access pattern.
Uniform distribution of reads and writes.
Use of this enumeration literal shall indicate a Uniform distribution of reads and writes.
Sequential read.
Use of this enumeration literal shall indicate a sequential read pattern of access.
Sequential write
Use of this enumeration literal shall indicate a sequential write pattern of access.
Random Read of uncached data
Use of this enumeration literal shall indicate an access pattern of random reads of uncached data.
Random Read of cached data.
Use of this enumeration literal shall indicate an access pattern of random reads of cached data.
